channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overhanging branches, 18th June
item.description:
The hedge has become very overgrown and hanging low, so that people have to either duck to avoid catching or move out of edge of pavement. It has been like this for months and with the warmer weather the situation is getting worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging branches from a property in Rectory Lane, 18th June
item.description:
Overhanging branches from a property in Rectory Lane. Res rang said that he is registered blind, and wants to report overhanging bushes from a property in Rectory Lane, he says because he is blind he cannot be exact as to where this is. He says that as you are coming from Knoll Rd turning left into Rectory Lane - a few houses along - house has got a iron gate with a brick wall. Caller has tried to avoid this this morning but has nearly fallen in the road to avoid the bushes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Lane, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New tree has been hit by car, 18th June
item.description:
The new tree planted in front of Tesco / PureGym has been hit by a Tesco delivery vehicle and the support/cafe/stem are dislodged. Request someone comes to rectify to prevent further damage / death of the tree? Reg plate was YT69WGX
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 191-199, Southampton Way, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Items of furniture (bed headboard, base, drawers) dumped on pavement beside 29 Love Walk SE5., 18th June
item.description:
Resident of 29 Love Walk SE5 gas dumped various bed parts on the pavement outside their house. They were observed by other residents putting the stuff there and when asked about it by other residents they have acknowledged that they put the stuff there. It has now been there for three days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Love Walk, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
